intro: Pauridiantha mayumbensis, commonly known as the Mayumbé sand mat, is a rare flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with narrow, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typically visited by insects for pollination. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to the dry, seasonal climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
